result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carl L Rice

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered by court and trial reserved.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
3:43 PM (64-06) Defendant Carl L Rice in court.  Attorney John Robert Dade in court for Carl L Rice.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State called to the stand as a witness, Brody Fiedler.
Brody Fiedler duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA Herrmann.
Witness has identified the defendant in court. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed.   Exhibit #1 offered and received by the Court.
3:49PM - Cross examination by Attorney Dade.
3:50PM - Argument by ADA Herrmann.
3:50PM - Argument by Attorney Dade.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 
Attorney Dade acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading, defendant is standing silent and asking the court to enter a plea of not guilty to all charges.
Court enters pleas of not guilty to all charges on behalf of the defendant.

Adj. 3:54PM
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Reset Request - PH - 09-09-22;

Attachment to reset request
Signed bond filed with the court.

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Carl L Rice in court. Attorney John Dade for defendant. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Dade. Argument, bond amended to $5000 cash. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested. Time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Carl L Rice in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Defendant to recontact SPD to see if he qualifies while in custody. Cash bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
